title: Differential Effects of Endocrine Therapy Type on Quality of Life in Older (≥70 Years) Women with Early-Stage Breast Cancer.
abstract: There is limited data on health-related quality of life (HRQoL) in older breast cancer (BC) patients. This study examines patient-reported outcomes (PROs) by type of endocrine therapy (ET) prescribed, aromatase inhibitors (AI), or tamoxifen (Tam) to estrogen receptor-positive BC patients aged ≥70 years.
